titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of research materials related to various cemeteries, particularly in the Philadelphia area. Cemeteries include Laurel Hill, Lafayette, Woodlands, burial ground of First Reformed Church, Upper Burying Ground in Germantown, Christ Church burial ground, Bensalem cemetery (transfers from Lafayette), Bellevue Cemetery, Fourth Reformed Church in Manyunk, Friends' Burial Ground at Fair Hill, Philanthropic Cemetery, Palmer Street Cemetery, and Ronaldson Cemetery. There is also information on a veterans' cemetery in Bucks County and colonial graves in Independence Mall. Research materials are mainly clippings and photocopies from newspaper articles and books. There is also a typewritten history of Oddfellows Cemetery, a 1974 address by Edwin S. Dunkerley on Philadelphia cemeteries that was given at a meeting of GSP, and photographs and negatives of American Mechanics Cemetery.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
